isis.stitle: RADIATOR, REMOVE AND REPLACE - 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700 Models - RADIATOR AND COMPONENT REMOVAL - COOLING SYSTEM RADIATOR HOSE

svcproc.title: COOLING SYSTEM RADIATOR HOSE
svcproc.para: The International cooling system is fitted with Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamps on the radiator connections. A special tool is required ( Figure 22) for the removal of the Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamp. The recommended tool for this application is a heavy duty clamp cutting tool, model number ZTSE4479 available through International Truck and Engine Corporation.

step1.para: Beginning on the drivers side of radiator, locate the radiator hose end closest to the radiator ( Figure 21, Item 1) and the Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamp ( Figure 21, Item 3).

calloutgroup.callout1: 3. GATES POWER GRIP SB HEAT SHRINK CLAMPS

step1.para: Utilizing the SB clamp cutting tool, melt away clamp on the cooling system hose, drivers side, closest to the radiator ( Figure 23, Item 2).

The entire hose connection does not have to be removed to remove radiator. If the existing hose is to be replaced the SB tool must be used on both ends of hose with Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamp ( Figure 24, Items 1 and 3).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Gates Power Grip SB Heat Shrink Clamp Removal

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. GATES POWER GRIP SB HEAT SHRINK CLAMP AT RADIATOR PORT

step1.para: Locate lower passenger side radiator hose and heat shrink clamp closest to the radiator, and melt away heat shrink clamp.
